snippet: The World Health Organization reported steep declines in malaria cases and deaths compared with 2000 in a report released early Tuesday, saying the progress was particularly notable in Africa, where the disease is most prevalent.
abstract: World Health Organization reports steep declines in malaria cases and deaths compared with 2000, but says it could worsen again in Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone, where public health systems have been overwhelmed by Ebola virus.
lead_paragraph: The World Health Organization reported steep declines in malaria cases and deaths compared with 2000 in a report released early Tuesday, saying the progress was particularly notable in Africa, where the disease is most prevalent.

headline.main: Malaria Scourge Has Declined Globally, but Ebola May Affect Toll, W.H.O. Says
headline.print_headline: Malaria Scourge Has Declined Globally, but Ebola May Affect Toll, W.H.O. Says
